children.value: The best NodeJS API for Starblast
is the JavaScript library for hosting modded
Introducing OOP (Object-Oriented Programming) into Starblast Modding
Provides a new way to approach Starblast Modding rather than the old format used in
Includes new features and events that doesn't exist in the original Modding Interface
Modding wherever you want, on your own server
Regularly updates to catch up with latest Starblast server updates and bugs fixes
Modding where you want, when you want
Modding in your favorite IDE, in your favorite OS with NodeJS.
Use NodeJS APIs to make interactive and dynamic mods.
Take advantage of NodeJS to host high-performance mods with low performances.

contents.title: Getting Started with Starblast Modding
contents.description: From your ideas to a fully functional Starblast mod in just a few steps.

children.value: From your ideas to a fully functional Starblast mod in just a few steps.
You can start exploring the Starblast Modding API in your browser using the official documentation:
Start by setting up your development environment:
Navigate to your mod directory and install the dependencies:
Run the mod with npx to start your mod in development mode:

contents.title: Project Structure
contents.description: Docus is a Nuxt theme that provides a ready-to-use documentation website, if you are familiar with Nuxt, you will feel right at home.

children.value: Docus is a Nuxt theme that provides a ready-to-use documentation website, if you are familiar with Nuxt, you will feel right at home.
This is the recommanded structure to dev/host a starblast mod.
directory is where you will dev your mod.
is where you configure host settings (like ECP Key, Region, etc...).
is where you will put your mod code.

The Browser Client Instance for supporting mod codes running in Browser Modding.
This client doesn't support undocumented features like accessing through game.modding, etc.
Some of the latest features of the new ModdingClient (which may not work in browsers) will be available.
Using Promise-related functionalities (including async/await) in your mod code is highly
since NodeJS VM doesn't work well with Promise, and will likely crash or hang the running mod.
same with option specified at ModdingClient
same with option specified at ModdingClient

Context where mod and command is executing on will be persistent across mod runs
Loading the same code will trigger the execution or not.
This feature only works when you call
methods, and not during the auto-update process
When tick or event function, or mod code execution fails, the mod will crash
Game will log any errors or not
Game will log any in-game logs or not
Same with option specified at ModdingClient
Executes any terminal command on current running instance.
Whether to allow eval the command as JavaScript or not.
THIS MAY CAUSE SECURITY ISSUES TO YOUR INSTANCE
Whether to capture execution output or pipe it to error/log events instead
Timeout for this execution, set to nullish to use default execution timeout from mod compilation
Success status (boolean) and output of given execution (if ouput capturing is enabled)
